definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams. ---E. Roosevelt.
sentences.chinese: 未来属于那些坚信他们梦中之美的人们。

sentences.english: And through the dream the future wept, grieving for the lost tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 梦中的未来悲恸哀泣，追悼失落的明天。

sentences.english: When lucid dreaming I still have access to all my waking memories.
sentences.chinese: 在清醒梦中我还可以触碰到所有清醒时的记忆。

sentences.english: I was plagued with dreams of explosions and screaming.
sentences.chinese: 梦中的爆炸和尖叫声困扰着我。

sentences.english: But the feeling that what is now is real has never changed, even in dream.
sentences.chinese: 但即使梦中，那当下如是的感觉从来不变。

sentences.english: Sometimes there is truth in dreams.
Cloud ah, gently wafted, a dream that came out a little bit outline.
sentences.chinese: 云啊，轻轻飘过来，梦中轮廓一点点透露出来。

sentences.english: In my dream, I not only met Lazy Sheep but also Big Big Wolf.
sentences.chinese: 梦中，我不仅见到了懒羊羊，还遇到了灰太狼。

sentences.english: Your face haunts my dreams like the rain at night.
sentences.chinese: 萦绕梦中，犹若夜雨，画的都是你的影。

sentences.english: In my dreams you are still mine.
Dream consciousness is not the same as wakeful consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 梦中意识和清醒意识并不相同。

sentences.english: Outside the window was the divine night, and the stars in my dream were staring into me.
sentences.chinese: 窗外是肃穆的夜，梦中的寒星与我静静地对望。

sentences.english: The years seemed to have telescoped, like time in a dream.
sentences.chinese: 那几年时光好像梦中时间一样重叠了起来。

sentences.english: The fairy mistress of dreams is coming towards you, flying though the twilight sky.
sentences.chinese: 梦中的精灵正穿越薄暮的天空向你飞来。

sentences.english: Though in visions, sweet lady, perhaps you may smile.
But when I sleep, in dreams they look on thee.
sentences.chinese: 而当我入睡，梦中却向你凝望。

definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
to dream about (sth or sb)/to see in a dream
lit. a dream of Nanke/fig. dreams of grandeur
separated by a generation/a lifetime ago
